website_summaries.verdict: No need to sacrifice comfort and mobility if cost is an issue, thanks to this budget-friendly wheeled shower chair.
pros: Some users find this more sturdy than PVC chairs, although backrest is still PVC
Offers both durability and comfort for long periods of time while showering or using the toilet
Larger wheels move smoothly across both hard surfaces and carpet
cons: Some users found it hard to assemble

customer_reviews.title: Not stable and moves when locked
customer_reviews.text: The main problem with this thing is it moves with the wheels locked. And it’s super hard to lock the wheels to begin with. I used it to shower twice and it was quite a production. I ordered a transfer bench and that makes it a breeze. I would hav ereturned it. But, I threw away the box and am not mobile to go find another.
customer_reviews.author: Leza M. Heed

customer_reviews.title: No comfort
customer_reviews.text: The back of this chair is very painful to thin backs and spinal cords. Opted for the MedMobile chair with a better back
customer_reviews.author: Comfort & Joy

customer_reviews.title: this is really great! very useful for my mom with 2 broken ...
customer_reviews.text: this is really great! very useful for my mom with 2 broken legs! The chair rolls over the toilet and is great in the shower. The only critic i have is that the seat loop should be open in front, to make wiping and cleaning easier! also if the breaks were at the front wheels that would be easier in a tight toilet room. this is a great chair for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mh

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: Great shower chair; sturdy and maneuverable. It’s comfortable and feels very stable. The only thing I don’t like is I couldn’t reach or set the brakes which are on the back wheels and very stiff. An improvement would be to add a set of light brakes on the front that would allow you to be stationary while washing yourself; apparently the designers never tried showering with the chair or this would have been obvious. Nonetheless, it is a very useful product that I would buy again if there was the need.
customer_reviews.author: harold carey

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well built,easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Ordered one for a disabled friend and saw what a tremendous aid it was for him that I ordered another for my husband as well. Sturdy and well made, amply-sized in the seat width, comfortable padding, Rolls easily, back wheels lock. Was very easy to assemble..
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: worked great
customer_reviews.text: This chair worked great once we padded the arms and put some padding across the back at the top. So they need to pad both of those places. The arms and across the top. The padded seat made a difference for the person it was bought for once we modified it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Gallops

customer_reviews.title: STURDY! EASY TO ROLL! A MIRACLE!!
customer_reviews.text: THIS thing is GREAT!! My 99 y.o. dad fell and banged his knee up. We had to help him shower and the shower seat we had was dangerous. Wet humans are slippery! And century-old skin is fragile. This chair is VERY easy to assemble and the generously large wheels make it SOOOO easy to roll. I recommend it without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: Lifelong Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Delivered without screws, washers or locknuts!
customer_reviews.text: Needed this immediately due to accident which keeps me from putting any weight on my feet for 12 weeks. It arrived without the necessary hardware to put it together. Directions say "The washers are contoured to fit against the tubing." Will my wife be able to find such washers at the hardware store?
customer_reviews.author: David L. Barton

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair
customer_reviews.text: We got this chair to help a person with a disability with showering. I was very easy to put together and it works great in the shower. Would order it again for someone or recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Not a sturdy seat
customer_reviews.text: Hey don't buy this chair. My husband was placed on it today and the cushioned seat folded in half. I'm going to try to shore it up somehow and keep it, only because we need the rolling chair for access to the shower. However if I had any idea this seat would be this defective, I would never had ordered it. My caregiver was incredulous and then said,"Made in China."
customer_reviews.author: Saundra A.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply constructed
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend this chair It is flimsy, breaks do not really work, its construction and materials are cheap Not adjustable height, the only plus is the nice cushion seat.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Need to reorder two wheels with brakes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my mother, who broke her hip and never regained strength to walk. It has been working fine except that the brakes are not really strong enough to hold it completely stable. Finally, they have completely stopped working. So, I called the contact number on the sticker which is on the frame of the device to re-order new wheels. It's an 877 number which goes to some scam place in the Philippines trying to send me some gift card and a shipping charge of $4.95. I told them I didn't want the gift card...just the wheels with brakes. I have no idea what to expect, but I'm checking my credit card, daily!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seat back is the problem
customer_reviews.text: Product was as described. Went together very well and quickly. Fits over the toilet and the padded seat is comfortable. The opening is nice and large for showering. Or main problem is the seat back. The seat back is so close to the back of the seat you cannot adjust yourself backwards and it also sits straight up so I find it difficult to clean my stomach and genital areas.
customer_reviews.author: Lorie

customer_reviews.title: Backrest broke
customer_reviews.text: This shower chair is easy to assemble and is sturdy. It rolls easily over the carpet. The problem I had is my wife tends to fall back into the seat and over time the back rest broke. I like the chair overall, so I bought another one and the same thing happened. I think for most people it will work fine. Just not the right chair for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Can replacement seats be ordered?
customer_reviews.text: The padded seat has cracked and unless we can find a replacement seat, the entire chair will need to be discarded.
customer_reviews.author: R. Misdom

customer_reviews.title: Easy Assembly!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, instructions good. Didn't have to use clamps as I thought. I just propped each front/rear leg side on table and assembled each following piece one bolt at a time. Then sat whole assembly on floor to level and tightened all 12 bolts. After that I went around twice to tighten them solidly. Easy!
customer_reviews.author: Raknar

customer_reviews.title: Saved my Ass.....well really my knees  :)
customer_reviews.text: I've had both of my knees replaced in the last year. This product literally allowed me to use the restroom without discomfort getting up and down off of the toilet. Very good for the price. Definitely recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Uneven, therefore unsafe
customer_reviews.text: This product is unsafe. The wheels are not even on the floor which causes it to wobble On a slight incline because one wheels lifts off the ground the brake does not keep the chair in place. For elderly people the movement and instability causes a bit of panic. Their is a flaw in the assembly

customer_reviews.title: Better than the ones Medicare provides
customer_reviews.text: I have used it 18 months and it has held up well. My husband had one provided by medicare a few years ago but water got in the holes where it adjusted and rusty water came out onto the shower tile after a while. We threw it away. When he needed one again after falling and breaking his leg, we decided to purchase this one. It has held up very well. The locks on back legs don't keep it from moving but since it sits against the shower wall, it hasn't been a problem for us. I think the locks are ok, but the chair is so lightweight that it could move anyway if it was in an open area.
customer_reviews.author: Nonny

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid, well constucted chair.
customer_reviews.text: This chair ships in a compact box and is easy to put together. It does NOT come with a bucket, which wasn't a problem for me. It is different from the last chair in that the frame slants from the back instead of from the front. Again, not a problem. It does come with heavy duty wheels, which was a problem with the last chair. Seat is fixed, does not raise up. The fabric on the chair, like all show chairs I've ever seen, will not last very long. You will need to be able to sew your own. I would recommend this chair.
customer_reviews.author: mcff

customer_reviews.title: Seat is made out of cardboard...not for use with heavier people.
customer_reviews.text: The seat is made out of card board and the bars only go under the seat so far...after 5 months use my Dad (190#) sat on it and the seat bent. I don't know that a person would go to the floor....but poor construction for a heavier person. It seems to be holding up good other wise.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. K. T.

customer_reviews.title: This was a God send. It's high enough so ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a God send. It's high enough so that I can pull myself up. Use over the toilet, and move to shower for use. I'm thinking of getting another one; one for bathroom; one for shower.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Anderson
